summary:
I have been working for 10 years in IT sector. I worked predominantly in area of database development. I was involved mostly with Oracle database. Also, I have more than 9 years of experience with Oracle Financials. I have worked as technical consultant, analyst and programmer. My last post was Oracle Principal Techno-Functional Consultant in the IT Oracle Consulting and Development Team at Orascom Construction Ltd. (OCL). I believe that the experience and skills that I have gained through out those 9 years make me fit for this position.
In my current position, I’m working as a Project Leader to implement Oracle E-Business Suite (HRMS, Financial, Assets and Procure to Pay – 11i/R12) from the Analysis Phase till the Go-Live Production Phase for Orascom Construction Company’s Sister Companies, Subsidiaries and Mega Projects. 
In addition to the above functionalities’ roles, I’m working on designing, developing, and supporting high level managerial reports in Oracle ERP (11i and R12) modules with some intelligent dynamic search criteria using Oracle development tools and utilities such as Oracle Forms 6i/9i, Oracle Reports 6i/9i, and Oracle Graphics Builder 6i/9i.
As an Oracle Database Schema Expert, I’m working on data warehousing from multiple databases using database links. Also, I’m engaged in developing PL/SQL packages, procedures, and functions to implement complex business logic and generate barcodes and sending automatic E-Mails with HTML attachments; in addition to, uploading/updating mass data with database scripts and Interface Tables (Oracle APIs).
Also, I’m responsible for providing detailed Oracle training sessions to the End Users, Top Management Users, and Super Users with detailed customised Oracle User Guides.
Last but not least, one of the main responsibilities in my role is creating and revising documentations for the above Functional and Technical tasks.

projects.title: Implemented Oracle ERP Procure-to-Pay 11i – Purchasing, and Inventory at Orascom Construction Industries (OCI), Head office - Egypt, Cairo
projects.description:
•	Worked in a team of 4 functional consultants/developers remotely.
•	Implemented core Oracle Procure-to-Pay setups “P2P” – Purchasing, and Inventory setup for more than 40 projects and integrated with Oracle Financial modules at the Head office.
•	Trained the end-users of each project.
•	Developed more than 10 customized reports to serve the needs of each project.
•	Supported the application customization and daily issues/requirements remotely.


SUCCESS STORY – ORACLE EGYPT

“Orascom Construction Industries Completes Project-Approval Cycle in Hours Instead of Five Days, Thanks to Automated Procure-to-Pay”

http://www.oracle.com/us/corporate/customers/customersearch/orascom-construction-1-ebs-ss-1955552.html

OCI implemented Oracle Financials modules and later looked to expand its Oracle E-Business Suite footprint to drive financial processing conformity and standardize business processes across all business units. Back in 2005, OCI added Oracle Human Resources and Oracle Payroll for more accurate cost and resource tracking at both departmental and project levels. The company also deployed Oracle Procure-to-Pay across 45 industrial business units to deliver precise reporting for top management and enable more accurate and efficient purchase request (PR) and purchase order (PO) routing and processing.

OCI can now efficiently manage and unify employee, supplier, and customer data across all application modules, driving accurate information flow and enabling PR and PO status tracking, from issuance to payment. As a result, OCI can provide a more accurate view of costs for all construction and industrial materials used on each project, which its cost-control engineers can access immediately whenever materials are released from warehouses. OCI has also reduced the project-approval cycle from five days, when using manual spreadsheets and paper forms, to just hours with Oracle Procure-to-Pay purchasing recognition and rapidly centralized order transfers.

profile_positions.description:
- Managing, planning and implementing Oracle EBS modules (Financial, Procure to Pay - P2P and Order to Cash - O2C).
- Leading business analysis meetings and coordinating with Oracle Super Users and other Stakeholders to identify the system, operational requirements, and proposed enhancements.
Coordinating with the Company Stakeholders to improve the Company Business Processes.
- Offering the best suggestions to match the Oracle ERP capabilities and applying it.
- Assisting customers on defining integrated testing scenarios and monitoring, reviewing, preparing and executing testing plans to ensure high quality results.
- Knowledge of all aspects of the company operations, i.e. Asset Management Strategy, Purchasing, Billing (BOM), Costing, Inventory Management, Cash Management and Cash Flow.
Training the Users and Super Users on Oracle E-Business Suite Modules: General Ledger, Receivables, Payables, Cash Management, Fixed Assets and Supply Chain Modules (Inventory, PO, and OM).
- Performing intensive testing with check list – self-made, or using the Oracle Application Testing Suite for the Oracle Functional Testing and the Oracle Load Testing.
- Reviewing and preparing detailed functional design documents for setup, user guides, alterations, interfaces, and reports.
- Designing, developing, and supporting high level managerial reports in Oracle ERP modules with some intelligent search dynamic criteria.
Utilizing and applying other Oracle development tools such as Oracle Forms 6i/9i, Oracle Reports 6i/9i, and Oracle Graphics Builder 6i/9i.
- Data warehousing and Manipulating data from multiple databases.
- Developing PL/SQL packages, procedures, and functions to implement Complex Business Logic, Barcodes and Send Automatically E-Mails (HTML Attachments).
- Developing and generating Oracle Alerts with SQL Statements.
- Uploading and updating mass data with database scripts and Interface Tables - APIs.
- Designing database link to connect two or more databases.
profile_positions.title: Oracle Techno-Functional Consultant

profile_positions.description:
	Working as a Project Leader to implement Oracle EBS (General Ledger, Receivables, Payables, Cash Management, Fixed Assets Purchasing and Inventory) in Orascom Head Office, Subsidiaries and Mega Projects.
	Working as a Team Member to upgrade and migrate Oracle EBS from 11i to R12, and as a Team Leader to redevelop all current customized reports along all EBS modules.
	Collaborating with business users to define extensible processes that meet the current and future business and organizational needs following the best practices in regional market.
	Assisting customers on defining integrated testing scenarios and monitoring these tests.
	Training the Users and Super Users on Oracle E-Business Suite Modules (General Ledger, Receivables, Payables, Cash Management, Fixed Assets Purchasing and Inventory - 11i and R12).
	Reviewing, preparing and executing testing plans to ensure high quality results.
	Performing L3 Support tasks for Off-Shore and Local Companies’ Subsidiaries.
	Performing intensive testing with check list – self-made, or using the Oracle Application Testing Suite for the Oracle Functional Testing and the Oracle Load Testing.
	Opening and monitoring SRs with Oracle Product Support Services – Metalink.
	Reviewing and preparing detailed functional design documents for setup, user guides, alterations, interfaces, and reports.
	Designing, developing, and supporting high level managerial reports in Oracle ERP (11i and R12) modules with some intelligent search dynamic criteria.
	Utilizing and applying other Oracle development tools such as Oracle Forms 6i/9i, Oracle Reports 6i/9i, and Oracle Graphics Builder 6i/9i.
	Data warehousing and Manipulating data from multiple databases.
	Developing PL/SQL packages, procedures, functions, database links, and Oracle Alerts to implement Complex Business Logic, Barcodes and Send Automatically E-Mails (HTML Attachments).
	Uploading and updating mass data with database scripts and Interface Tables - APIs.

profile_positions.description:
- Working as a Team Member to implement Oracle EBS (General Ledger, Receivables, Payables, Cash Management, Fixed Assets Purchasing and Inventory) in the following Orascom Sister Companies and Mega Projects:
   o	Orascom Algeria Head Office – Algeria, Algeria.
   o	OCI Saudi Arabia Limited Company, Head Office – Jeddah, KSA.
   o	The Grand Egyptian Museum – Cairo, Egypt.
- Attending and managing analysis sessions directly with users to discuss their requirements and workflow solution.
- Training users on ERP Oracle E-Business Suite Modules (Financial, Purchasing, Inventory and Order Management - 11i and R12).
- Performing intensive testing with check list – self-made, or using the Oracle Application Testing Suite for the Oracle Functional Testing and the Oracle Load Testing.
- Developing PL/SQL packages, procedures, and functions to implement complex business logic.
- Utilizing and applying other Oracle development tools such as Oracle Forms 6i/9i, Oracle Reports 6i/9i, and Oracle Graphics Builder 6i/9i.
- Performing application tuning to improve code performance.
- Creating supportive tables with ODBC tool.
- Uploading and updating mass data with database scripts and Interface Tables.
- Designing, developing, and supporting reports in ERP (11i and R12) modules (HRMS, Financial, Purchasing, and Inventory).
- Defining Oracle reports on Application level with intelligent search criteria - dynamic parameters.
- Designing database link to connect two or more databases.
- Developing intelligent, high level managerial, and cash flow reports with graphs for multi-databases.
- Supporting daily issues and bugs on the both sides – Application and Database.
- Managing and training summer trainees to help them adapt with the working environment.
- Developing useful and important documents and Users Guide.
